ygData.msgSnippet: ... For some reason, pets don t seem to have as much trouble as mobs negotiating the stairs and corners.  The method I always used to unstick them was to charm
ygData.messageBody:
On Wed, 17 Mar 1999, SteelWolf wrote:
>
> would pull from lower in the temple, we found the lizards would get
> stuck on the corner by the stairs down. We found it annoying, but we'd
> simply have 3-4 of us go to that corner and kill the lizard then run
> back. We did this for a few hours and made great exp.

For some reason, pets don't seem to have as much trouble as
mobs negotiating the stairs and corners. The method I always
used to unstick them was to charm them. Then they'd follow me
without any problems (give them a /pet follow me command if
they're stubborn). I think the AI is getting confused about
the range to target (close enough to stop moving, far enough
that it can't attack), because you'd think mobs and pets would
use the same pathing.

> A guide messaged our group leader and said "thank you for not exploiting
> the faulty pathing in this area of the dungeon". It was actually kind of
> nice to have it mentioned, since we were a bit irritated at having to
> meet our pulls half-way. I know the temple's pathing has been bugged for

Yeah, it seems half the players consider it an annoyance, and
the other half consider it an opportunity.

--
